replies.bodyText: unfortunately it is not the same here? They are using the same object but in case of list most of the field is null
replies.author: doktoric

replies.bodyText: yeah, right, instead of creating a new, the old one's items should be overridden, that should do the trick. but the old implementation did the same, creating a new SubnetworkList object and adding subnetoworks to it's items.

timeline.bodyText: this constant at least should be refactored into a field to avoid duplication here

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need this if, just use subnetIds
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: it would be much nicer if it would return with like a map and we could use filter.putAll where it is called instead of modifying the map passed via a parameter. It could return with empty map if not applicable
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: could be moved to a separate method, like createFilter

timeline.message: CB-9849 GCP : For FreeIPA use the GCP shared project id to query the networks

CB-9849 GCP : For FreeIPA use the GCP shared project id to query the networks

CB-9849 GCP : For FreeIPA use the GCP shared project id to query the networks

1. If a user gives a shared project id and a vpc in it, then the reverse DNS zone calculations in FreeIPA is not done correctly.
2. To fix this we need to look at the network and subnet in the shared project.
3. This is fixed everywhere except at one place here.
4. The ultimate issue will be that DH can not talk to IDBroker, it will receive 401 due to lack of reverse DNS.
5. CB-9180 will take care of bailing out if we can not calculate reverse DNS zones.

./gradlew build

3. This is fixed everywhere except at one place here.
4. The ultimate issue will be that DH can not talk to IDBroker, it will receive 401 due to lack of reverse DNS.
5. CB-9180 will take care of bailing out if we can not calculate reverse DNS zones.

./gradlew build
